The hotel reluctantly offered me 30,000 points on the Priority rewards program - an amount which barely covers one night at ANOTHER Crown Plaza. It has now been several months since my last (and I hope LAST) stay and they still have not placed the points in my account. The incompetence is consistant - from upper management to the front desk. Enjoy your experience - and the inevitible surprises!!!

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant is strictly ' Halal ', religion specific”
Reviews.Author: seamonkey1020
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at this hotel on Hotwire, for one night prior to our departure on a cruise. It was an average hotel as far as bed, friendliness, location and all that but a few things in their dining room made it a little disappointing to us. For one, it was not disclosed on any hotel description that the hotel restaurant was 'halal', meaning that it only served food permissable under Islamic law. The food offered was more tailored to those that are familiar with Middle Eastern dishes. Beef bacon at their breakfast buffet instead of the pork bacon we are used to, was not a very tasty substitute, in our opinion. The restaurant does make a good hamburger, so if you are there for lunch this is recommended. Gnats flying all around the dining room, however, helped ruin our dining experience regardless of the restaurant's food quality. If you decide to book a room, here, order delivery from 'Buono's Authentic Pizzeria', instead of dining downstairs. The pizza was delicious and no gnats !

Reviews.Title: “Mostly pleased with the Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: silentbob007
Reviews.Content: I booked the Crowne Plaza as a pre-cruise hotel that is very close to the LA Harbor where Royal Caribbean ships are berthed. I won the hotel with a $65 bid on Priceline, which seems to be a standard winning price at this property. I called a week ahead of time to see about requesting a room with two beds as I was traveling with my mother, and was told by the reservations person at the hotel that I had a king room and that if I didn't like it, I'd have to take it up with Priceline. I"m used to being denied this type of request befroe check-in, but the usual response is that a note will be made on the reservation in case a desired room was available. Not so here, and I felt it was handled a little poorly, but figured I might have better luck upon check-in. We caught an early, direct flight out of Indianapolis to LAX, and with the time change, we actually arrived at 8:30 AM. I had arranged a SuperShuttle to take us to the hotel ($17/pp), and we were dropped off around 10 AM. The lady at the front desk was very helpful and not only gave use a room with two beds, but also let us check in 5 hours early. I appreciated this, and we headed up to our room on the fifth floor. As per usual with a Priceline room, it was located at the end of the hall, but for the savings and the quietness that provides ... who cares? The room itself was very clean, though missing a few things (some of the sleep ammenities promised, a second coffee mug, etc), but we got these from a housekeeper we saw around. I was disappointed though that the wireless internet service was down and that the TV was getting horrible reception. The internet eventually started working ($10/day) and I figured out that I could get a good TV signal if I twisted the cord in back until it came through clearly. We ate lunch at the hotel restaurant and it was fine, though the food was nothing great and the service was pretty slow. The pool is a small outside one, along with a hot tub, and the exercise room consists of a treadmill, an elliptical, a few recumbent bikes, and various weight machines. I was slightly perturbed by the fact that there were no cleaning supplies in they gym as they had obviously run out a while ago and simply had not been replaced. We decided to get out of the room and walk around San Pedro. It was a Sunday afternoon and was very quiet. You can tell there is some neighborhood rejuvenation going on because of all of the places being ripped up and turned into apartments and condos. Within a few blocks of the hotel in each direction it seemed like a nice area, and then after that, buildings started deteriorating. There was a grocery/liquor store east of the hotel a block or two, but it looked a little scary to me. There are also a lot of shops and restaurants the opposite direction along the harbor. Later in the day, we headed towards the harbor and ate at a Mexican restaurant called The Green Onion. Prices were decent and the food was very good, though my mom later thought that the food didn't agree with her. The next morning we went to the Pacific Cafe, across the street from the hotel (exiting through the restaurant door). This was a nice little place that was seemingly run by a single lady, and I was able to get a ham/cheese omelet with two slices of sourdough toast for $3.95. The food was quite decent and the price could not be beat ... I'd definitely recommend this place over a chain like Starbucks (which is just down the block on the same side of the street as the hotel). The Crowne Plaza offered a free shuttle to the port starting at 10:30. We went down at about 10:45, climbed aboard, and were the only ones taken over to the ship. This shuttle picks up from the port, and it will also take people to a local mall and supposedly other places within a 5-mile radius. I asked about being taken to an In-N-Out Burger and was told "maybe later" that really seemed to be a "no" even though it was 3 miles away. All-in-all, this was a good stay and I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again for a pre-cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beds”
Reviews.Author: DiMe2
Reviews.Content: I am truly surprised this only gets a three-star rating on my travel sites: it was far better than the Hyatt we went to the following night. In the future I'll stay in San Pedro for any business I have in Long Beach: it costs less and the rooms here are much nicer than those I have seen in LB proper. Really an excellent bed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvnatur
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Crowne Plaza hotel the evening before our cruise. Upon arrival we were immediately greeted by a nicely dressed gentleman that asked us if we needed help with our luggage. We did need some assistance and a very nice man assisted us happily. The check-in process was quick and simple. The front staff wasnâ€™t overly friendly; they could use a happy class. The hotel is beautiful, we were very impressed. The room was very nice as well. We had a double bed room that overlooked the pool. The room is decorated with warm colors and beautiful white linens. The bathroom had granite counter tops and was very clean. There was a small bag that contained ear plugs, eye mask and a nice lavender linen spray. The beds were very comfortable. My only complaint is our room was next to the elevator, and oh my it was so noisy. I turned on the air conditioner to mute the sound, and it worked okay. The next day we had no problem getting a free shuttle ride to the pier. It was overall a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for our intended purpose................”
Reviews.Author: World-Traveller-one
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Friday night in preparation for a Saturday departure cruise. Party of 4 in one room with hot buffet breakfast (not a gourmet affair but quite adequate) and parking for the duration of the cruise. Room, with two comfortable double beds, was reasonably sized, as was bathroom - both were clean. This is worth consideration for cruise passengers who might need to leave home very, very early in the day for a long drive to make a 4 pm departure. Stay here for the night and start your cruise well rested.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: suzyhBoston
Reviews.Content: Do not hesitate to book this hotel before a cruise. Very nice accomidations- clean and comfy bedding. I do enjoy the Crowne Plaza line's attention to a good night sleep (complimentary ear plugs, lavender linen spray and a sleeping mask). The dining was OK- service was slow but the food was decent. My husband had a stir fry entree that was quite good. I ordered a pepper soup which was good as well. If I go back, I would enjoy a meal there again if I stayed at the hotel because...if you are there for anything aother reason, there is NOTHING else to really do in San Pedro. My husband and I walked around the neighborhood in the morning. At times I was scared and would turn my rings around. Not sure if it was all that bad but I was not very comfortable. I would not feel safe heading out at night in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise stay in San Pedro”
Reviews.Author: khillman93
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for one night before a cruise on the Golden Princess in February. We flew in from the East Coast and arrived at the hotel about 9ish pm local time. We used Go Sedan for our transfers and they were wonderful. They met us in baggage claim and took us straight to the bellman at the hotel. Great service! Initially, we requested a non-smoking king room. When I called the day of check in to confirm, they had me down for a smoking double. I again requested non-smoking king. When we checked in, I asked again. They said they had non-smoking but no kings. Then the clerk offered a handicapped non-smoking king which we were happy to take. Check in was very quick and easy. We used Priceline for our room. The desk clerk wasn't super friendly, but was quick, efficient and friendly enough. We checked in at the bell desk and they recommeded some places to eat nearby and provided a map for us. We ended up at the Green Onion, a Mexican restaurant almost right next door. The food and service were great. It was casual and reasonably priced. Perfect for weary travelers! The decor was a little different - almost like a Bennigan's. They had a bar. Our hotel room had a big chair and a desk. We didn't have a great view. The room was very clean, but a little worn. The shower was a little dark with decent water pressure. The bed was very comfortable. The room temperature was good. They even provided a clip to place on the curtains to keep them closed and keep the room dark. My only complaint about the hotel would be the thin walls. There was a very loud, rude family next door to us making ton of noise at 6am. We could hear almost every word they were saying (more like shouting). But you can't really fault the hotel for the behavior of obnoxious people. We didn't call and complain because we were ready to get up anyway. The next morning we went for a walk up 6th street I think - headed away from the port. We walked for a few blocks. At one of the main intersections, caddy corner to a thift store, we found the funky little San Pedro Deli and Cafe. What a great place to eat breakfast. The menu was varied. The service and the food were awesome. It was a great way to start our vacation. Plus it was a great value for the money. They give you a ton of food. I had 4 slices of french toast, 2 eggs and bacon for $4.99. My husband had an omelette, fried potatoes and buscuits and gravy for $7.59. It was much cheaper that eating at the hotel, and it was nice to experience some local flavor. We also passed several other lunch/dinner restaurants as well as a local coffee shop and a Starbucks. We saw a sign for a liquor store, but it looked like it was closed down. We also saw a wine shop, but it wasn't open yet. I did not see a drug store near the hotel but we didn't ask about one either. The hotel had a gift shop, bar, restaurant, pool and hot tub that we did not use. When we checked in, we asked about the port shuttle and they gave us a paper with the information. They provide service to LA port in San Pedro and to Long Beach for Carnival Cruises. Check out was a breeze - we did express check out over the phone. We carried our own luggage down and were on the first shuttle at 10:30. There were only three of us on the shuttle. The ride was only 5-10 minutes tops. They also provide return shuttle service to the hotel, but we didn't use that service. All in all, it was a great place to stay before our cruise. I would highly recommended it for a pre-cruise stay because it is in a great location, the service was good, and the rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Pre-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: SC_Sam
Reviews.Content: We took a taxi from LAX to the Crowne Plaza San Pedro. Our cabbie didnâ€™t know where the hotel was, but since I had printed out our confirmation information, he was able to call and get the directions. (Moral of the story: always have a printed copy of your hotel reservation confirmation.) When we arrived at the hotel, bellmen took our many bags and followed us up to the rooms after check-in. 2 of our 3 rooms were upgraded to Executive Suite rooms, which was nice. The bedding was incredibly comfortable and the bathtub was huge. After a long day of traveling and the frustration of the ground transportation, DW definitely enjoyed the nice relaxing bath. The bellmen who assisted with checking-in had told us that the hotelâ€™s shuttle service started at 10:30 in the morning, but if we wanted to be first out, to call for the bellmen about 10:00. We did so, and were on the first shuttle by about 10:15. We arrived at the port by 10:30.

Reviews.Title: “Great for pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Beth76
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! We got it for $65 on priceline. It would have been worth the regular price. We arrived at 11pm and our key cards were already made up. The desk clerk typed our names in the computer and handed us the cards. Fastest check-in ever. The hotel had a very nice, modern decor. The room was very clean and comfortable. The amenity kit included linen spray, a relaxation CD, an eye mask and ear plugs. They also had shampoo and soap etc. The lighting in the room was more ambient than task though. I had to put my make-up on in the bathroom. No big deal though. The free shuttle to the port was very easy and convenient. We only had one small complaint which wasn't the hotel's fault. My husband wanted a snack when we arrived, but the little snack shop was closed when we got there. We were hoping to pick up a little something for breakfast there, but they only had a few snacks--no breakfast foods. It was more of a gift shop than a food store. Again, not a big deal. The restaurant was opened for breakfast but we didn't want to sit down, so we just ate when we got on the ship. I will definitely stay here again if sailing out of San Pedro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moinhilde
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel prior to our cruise leaving Dec. 17th. Check-in was efficient in the very spacious and nicely decorated reception area. We got a room on the 10th floor with access to the concierge lounge which included appetizers, drinks and breakfast for the next morning. The room was large with a partial view towards the water and bridge. The bed was one of the most confortable we have ever had in a hotel room. It came with a Relaxation-CD, lavender linen spray and a mask for a good nights rest. What more could one ask for? Convenient also is the free shuttle bus to the very close cruise terminal . It was well worth the $119.- we payed.

Reviews.Title: “Total Disaster!”
Reviews.Author: HomesAtHome
Reviews.Content: The incompetence of the staff was mind-boggling. We finally accepted that if we had any kind of question or need for service, we would need to go down to the front desk to handle it in person, and it almost always took more than one person to handle the simplest request. At a Motel 6, OK - but at a Crowne Plaza? The topper was when I checked out - when they brought my vehicle up from valet parking (which is a separate parking area to which only the bell staff have access), one of the doors had a huge dent in it. That door wouldn't even open. I filed a report with the hotel and waited for a phone call. I returned to the hotel the following week on my way out of town, and was again assured that I would be contacted as soon as the manager was in the next day. This happened over a month ago, and I haven't even had the courtesy of a single phone call. The restaurant staff were helpful, but the hotel staff haven't the first clue about serving a customer. After my stay here, I will never stay in a Crowne Plaza hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, ideal pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: seacoasters
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the first stop in our around the world trip to celebrate a special wedding anniversary and it got the trip off to a flying start. We chose the hotel because of the favourable reviews, variety of local eating places, proximity to the port - from which we were to depart on a cruise, and the free shuttle services offered to a large shopping mall and the port. The Staff All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful particularly the concierge staff who had advice on things to do and places to eat locally, which added to the flavour of our stay. The Hotel On arrival the foyer was largish, light, well furnished and gave the impression of comfort and made us feel like we would enjoy our stay. There is a small shop selling snacks, drink - including milk, suntan lotion and other items at reasonable prices. The lifts were of reasonable size and opened onto wide, well lit and clean corridor to our room. The first impression of our room was large, tasteful dÃ©cor, clean and comfortable. Two large double beds, two arm chairs, foot stall, desk and TV etc. The bathroom was also clean and well presented. Two gripes. The first being that there were only one creamer and sugar by the coffee maker. Second, the air-conditioning didn't sound too bad during the day, but was a bit noisy at night. A fridge would have been nice, but there is an ice bucket and we found an ice machine on one of the floors. Although the hotel is situated on the corner of two side roads there is little traffic and we heard no noise in our room. We used the hotel restaurant only once and found the food reasonable and the prices moderate to high. We were not impressed with the service however. There is a pleasant outside area next to the restaurant with tables, chairs and umbrellas where you can sit for a meal or take drinks from the bar. The gated pool and surrounding area, which included a jacuzzi, loungers, tables with umbrellas and chairs, are clean and well presented. Although this area is situated next to a road, the pool area is higher than the road, which is unnoticeable, and we didn't notice any disturbing noise. There are also fresh towels proved in a container by the pool. A pleasant area to lounge and enjoy the weather or read a book. If you are going to the pool remember to take your room card, as you will need this to gain access. The hotel free shuttle to the port of LA is about a twenty minute ride away so is great value. Would definitely stay here again. The surrounding area There are a number of eating places within a block or two ranging from snack bars to small restaurants at reasonable prices. Further afield, near the water, there are sea food bars and more restaurants. However, some of these are a mile or so away, so you may want to take a car or bus. There is a bus stop across the road from the hotel and I thought I saw a bus go from there down towards the water and the sea food bars. Ask the concierge I'm sure he would know. Shopping in the immediate area is virtually non-existent so take the hotel shuttle to the mall. We felt safe walking the area during the day but did not go out after dark so cannot comment. We discovered a film being made a block from the hotel and spent a pleasant hour watching take after take. The film was going to be part animated so watching actors reacting to something that wasn't there was quite hilarious. Los Angeles Airport to Crowne Plaza We read somewhere that the journey from LAX to The Crowne Plaza should take about 45 minutes, but at certain times of the day, rush hour for example, the journey can take up to two hours. So with this in mind we pre-booked a car with Prime Time to meet us at LAX. The cost is not much more than a taxi (based on a 45 minute journey time) and included the tip. We were two hours late getting into LAX and also had to wait some time for our bags, so were a bit worried about the meet. However, our fears were dashed when we arrived out in the concourse to see our name being displayed by the driver - brilliant!!!

Reviews.Title: “Crown was just fine!”
Reviews.Author: Tom43302
Reviews.Content: The Crown Plaza was very nice! It was perfect for an overnight stay before our cruise. We had no problems and they did not change for parking!! I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: camphi
Reviews.Content: Very good bed and large room. Restaurant was closed for refection but some good restaurants (Grinder ok) at a walking distance (hotel provides a list). Hotel & service was excellent, with a free shuttle to the very close pier of cruises. Will definitively stay there again.... Philippe, Belgium, French speaking.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: tweek
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best beds I have ever sleeped in.. wow, they are awesome with the pillows and down comforter.. we had a suite that over looked the pier where the ships came in.. had dinner downstairs in the restaurant which was only okay.. expensive and not very good.. but the hotel & service was excellent.. will definately stay again if we ever go back out to LA

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: thetravelbug101
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights before a cruise. The location was perfect. We enjoyed the local sights within walking distance eg Ports-a-call, the Maritime museum and restaurants. I have sleep "issues". I WANT that bed. Wow, the best sleep I've had in years. I was even able to take a 3 hour "power nap". lol. The food and bar served their purpose, the pool and view were okay. The restaurant one block up that the bellman recommended is really worth writing about. Pappadokas...of football fame. It is an old family owned greek place. The owner (the father of the football giants) is a smooth character full of charm. He was half the fun. The food was fabulous. The entertainment even better. The owner and one of the waiters started dancing, the music was great. The belly dancer part was a little tasteless, but she was very pretty. The former manager of the Dodgers was there, another family celebrating grandpa's 97th birthday, a USC student celebrating the running of her first marathon. It's was a lot of fun. I will go back to the Crowne to sleep in that bed and eat at that restaurant. Wow!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for quiet precruise stay.”
Reviews.Author: LesMary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 4 nights, 27,28,29, 30 August 2007, prior to leaving on Regal Princess Cruise. We had just left Peru a bit shook up having been there during the earthquakes mid month. Arrival: We arrived at the hotel about 9am from LAX and found staff very friendly and helpful, they had our room ready by 11am, great. Room: Room was on 10th floor, good views, spacious, very comfortable beds. Quiet hotel as well. Hotel amenities: Great pool and gym, restaurant good, good buffett breakfast hot and cold for $9. Had dinner everynight in the hotel restaurant, good value, service and big meals. On the Thursday night 30 Aug, hotel did their usual San Pedro Harbour Cruise, for hotel guests, drinks and snacks, very nice. Transport:: Hotel did free shuttle the short distance to Cruise Terminal, they had 2 buses doing that, great. Overall a nice hotel in a quiet area of San Pedro, which is quiet anyway. Highly recommended for a few days precruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: UnhappyBrideNd
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks very nice from the inside out. We were to stay at the hotel from a Thurs night until Mon morning the following week when we were to get on a cruise to get married. On our second day at the hotel, we left the room to go get lunch. As we walked out of the room, the housekeeper was cleaning the room next to ours, so we put our sign on the door to clean our room. We shut the door and I smiled at the housekeeper as we left. When we returned back to our room 3 1/2 hours later, the housekeeper had cleaned the room. However, all of our luggage had been gone through....there were things on the floor from our suitcases that weren't out of the suitcase before we left. Our laptop was stolen and so was a folder that contained all of our documents needed to get married and get on the cruise...to include our birth certificates of mine and my husbands and my 5-yr old daughters. We immediately contacted the manger and filed a report with the hotel and the LA Police Dept. It has now been a week and a half and we still have not been able to track down who took our stuff. The security that works at the hotel has not looked at the security tapes and they refuse to give me the name of the housekeeper who cleaned our room. To make matters worse, the manager of the hotel gave us a bucket of 6 beers and a free dinner at their restaraunt since it was "the least we can do". Come to find out, the housekeeper didn't speak English and had just started at the hotel. So, a case of stolen identity? I think so. Horrible customer service at this hotel. They don't take in account the huge impact this will have on our lives with us not knowing whether or not someone is using our names and worse, our social security numbers for their own personal gain. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great pre cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: abbyndrewmom
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay here for 2 nights before our Royal Caribbean cruise. We were upgraded to a suite which was very nice. The room was very comfortable, the bedroom had a king bed and there was a pull out couch in the sitting area. Parking was very convenient in an underground garage right under the hotel. Pool area is clean with lots of fresh towels available. the staff was proffesional and easy to deal.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in San Pedro”
Reviews.Author: MmePoppy
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding and booked here because other wedding guests were booked there. We were bumped up to a suite when we arrived - a very pleasant surprise, given we were there on a AAA rate. The room furnishings were plain but the bed linens were stylish and attractive with an abundance of decorative pillows. The bathroom was small but spiffy, with a large tub. We had dinner in the restaurant where a new menu was in the works. One of us had spaghetti and meatballs, the other a delicious Malaysian specialty called Mee Goreng - what a mix of nationalities! The breakfast buffet was just ok, but I liked the inclusion of a spicy Asian noodle dish. The hotel pool was very attractive with nice deck furnishings and a well-kept appearance. The lobby had a design board showing new furnishings planned for an upcoming redesign of the lobby. Overall, it felt like a place that was being well cared-for. Service at the desk and in the restaurant was uneven but generally friendly. The unsmiling manager seemed to be everywhere, checking up on everything. He should have smiled at his guests, though! Our wifi internet connection worked properly. The view of the hard-working harbor was interesting. Air conditioning worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Many Pros, Some Cons”
Reviews.Author: LondonLove330
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and attentive to our needs. We noticed that the a/c was not working in our room and someone was immediately sent up to take a look at it. The man said he fixed it, but the temperature in the room did not change all night. We decided that we couldn't take it anymore so we called the front desk. They said the maintenance people had gone home for the day, but they could offer us a new room. We jumped at the chance, because we just wanted to sleep comfortably! We got our new keys and found our new room. Much to our surprise, it was one of the suite rooms at the end of the hall with a sitting area, two tvs, a king size bed, and many windows looking out to the pier. We couldn't believe we got this room for the price of our double room!!! Both rooms were spacious, clean, and very modern looking. We did the buffet breakfast one morning and it wasn't too bad. The beds are SO comfortable! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Cruises”
Reviews.Author: JA/IRBolton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location if you are taking a cruise out of Lax port. We stayed on the Club floor in the new updated room. Bed and room was excellent could not fault. Breakfast was ok but nothing special. This will be a great hotel once all the work to update the hotel is complete. Free transfer shuttle to the port work very well and staff member very friendly. We would use again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: coggly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise. While being more expensive than some other hotels around, it was worth it. The hotel itself was very nice. The staff was helpful and always had a smile. We tried the room service for dinner, it was very good. The shuttle to the cruise terminal worked out great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Pedro.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & good price/value”
Reviews.Author: HWAYMI
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights pre-cruise. They make it so convenient--super shuttle service to & from pier and can leave car in secure, valet lot which is included in the Park & Cruise price. Room was spacious, clean & modern. Downside was remodeling not finished so pool was not open and hotel bar is closed. Otherwise, highly recommend & will always stay there pre or post cruise in LA. Staff were friendly and very helpful with directions, any needs we expressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great for pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: nurseamy99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel a couple of times prior to crusing out of San Pedro. They have great packages Park & Sail (if you drive they will keep your car for the week and transport you to & from the cruise termminal) and the Fly & Sail (they transport to & from the airport & to the cruise terminal) We have done both and that included breakfast in the morning. When we priced transportation & parking this was an exceptionaly good deal. The hotel itself is not outstanding but nice. The rooms are spacious and they were clean. I have recommended this hotel to many friends & family members prior to crusing. We are booked again this fall.

Reviews.Title: “Best Pre Cruise hotel In San Pedro”
Reviews.Author: TANMAN10
Reviews.Content: 8th floor room was clean with lavender spray for pillows...cd for sleeping...eyeshades and earplugs are provided but unnecessary we used them on ship actually...i got up early to video our ship 'diamond princess' arriving in san pedro..go see it here... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tXK37DF1-CQ breakfast was good in hotel and prior nights dinner was good at acapulco restaurant in nearby ports of call...all in all very good way to prepare for a cruise!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: bilashk
Reviews.Content: I received service far and above that of most hotels I've stayed in. Upon arriving I had mentioned that I was in need of a battery for my camera. The concierge over heard this and proceeded to drive my wife and I to the nearest electronic store and waited for us as I made my purchase. I asked the young lady at the front desk if I could have a room with a view of the ships. My wife and I were placed in a beautiful corner suite where I watched the cruise ships come in and out of port. The staff had tremendous knowledge of the area and did what ever they could to make our stay enjoyable. My stay at this Crowne Plaza Property allowed my holiday to get off to a wonderful start. Their biggest asset is the the staff at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: Mich_12345
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now called the Crowne Plaza Los Angeles Harbor Hotel. I stayed there on a recent weekend for a total or two nights. The hotel has a very nice lobby and the room I stayed in was nicely renovated. However, I had one problem with the hotel (hence the three star-rating). The hotel prominently advertises a "guaranteed wake up call" or your night is free -- this policy appears on a card in every guest room. On the last night of my stay, I asked for a wake up call for the next morning. 20 minutes after the time that I was supposed to get my wake-up, no call had been received. I called and notified the front desk of the missing wake-up call. They said they would "look into it". When I checked out a couple of hours later, I asked to receive a refund for one night's stay. They adamantly refused to honor their policy. They suggested that there may have been a problem with my phone line, or that I had not actually requested the wake-up call. The desk clerk said they could offer me a complimentary breakfast only, but I had already had breakfast and I was leaving town at that time. I don't think the hotel should advertise a policy that they are not willing to honor.
